titleInfo.title: Letter, P. S. Lincoln in Cincinnati, Ohio to W. J. Stevens in Nashville, Tenn., 1865 May 13

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated May 13, 1865, from P. S. Lincoln in Cincinnati, Ohio, to W. J. Stevens in Nashville, Tenn., Lincoln informs him that McCallum's Bridge Company has gone out of business, but that he can use their machines to make rails for 55 cents each. He explains that the price has been increased as the machine will be run for only this purpose and because the price of lumber has been increased. The letter also includes notes from W. J. Stevens and N.E. Van Sickle about the correct distances between the holes in the rails.

subject.topic: Railroad bridges -- Tennessee -- Loudon County -- Design and construction.
Railroad bridges -- Tennessee -- Loudon County -- Equipment and supplies.
